Original title: The Front Page
Year: 1974
105 min.
Country: United States
Director: Billy Wilder
Screenplay: Billy Wilder, I.A.L. Diamond (Play: Ben Hecht, Charles MacArthur)
Music: Billy May
Photography: Jordan Cronenweth
Starring: Jack Lemmon, Walter Matthau, Susan Sarandon, Vincent Gardenia, David Wayne, Allen Garfield, Austin Pendleton, Charles Durning, Herb Edelman, Martin Gabel, Harold Gould, Cliff Osmond, Dick O'Neill, Jon Korkes, Lou Frizzell, Paul Benedict, Doro Merande, Noam Pitlik, Joshua Shelley, Allen Jenkins, John Furlong, Biff Elliot, Barbara Davis, Leonard Bremen, Carol Burnett
Studio: Universal Pictures
Genre: Comedy | Satire. Journalism. 20s Remake

Synopsis
Chicago 1929. Ewan Williams, convicted of murdering a police jail waiting time of execution. Meanwhile, in the press room of the Supreme Court, a group of journalists waiting pardon or confirmation of the sentence. Hiddy Johnson, the chronicler of events in the Chicago Examiner, which should cover information, is about to marry and leave work; However, Walter Burns, the Machiavellian editor, determined to retain it, try to prevent their marriage by all means.

Awards
1974: David di Donatello Awards: Best Director and Foreign Actor (Lemmon and Matthau)
1974: Golden Globes: 3 nominations, including Best Picture Comedy / Musical
